reviews.review_msg: She's a very friendly person and is fairly approachable, but her class was very confusing and I feel as if I didn't learn that much. I didn't get how the readings were connected to course material, had no idea how I would be graded, and we were behind schedule by 2 weeks. I was really interested in the concept so it felt like I was snubbed a bit.
I will take another course with theis instructor again and wanted to turn to linguistic anthropology.

She does not care about her students, period. It is clear she knows her stuff, mainly her research, but will not support alternative views. If you need some sympathy from her, do not count on it, she will not give it to you. Incredibly pretentious outside of class. Remember to agree with everything she says or you wont get the mark you want.

Jie is a wonderful instructor. She is very enthusiastic about the material. She literally replies within minutes to my emails. Jie did not assign a textbook and instead emails articles to read each week, the articles are interesting and it was wonderful to not have to pay for another useless textbook.

Jie Yang is a wonderful person; however, her inability to communicate material and her poor class syllabus makes being in her class extremely frustrating. She takes forever to answer emails, and refuses to answer questions via email and insists that we meet her in person, which we may not always have time for. I will never take her class again.
